content:
AC Reporter

This exhibition runs from October thirtieth through December third in the EMUs Adell McMillan Gallery PERIOD Closing Reception day is December second at  PM and according to the University of Oregon Events Calendar refreshments will be provided Solitude is a new exhibition currently being featured in the Adell McMillan Gallery in the EMU PERIOD The Artist Ugandan photographer Desire Rukundo composes digital images of nature people and cities with a particular focus on movement inspired by solitude. pERIOD Sam Henry  The Daily Emerald

Staring deeply into the photos of Desire Rukundo brings you into his perspective PERIOD One of the photos captures the nontraditional angle of a horseback rider framing the horses head in front of the riders PERIOD This unique angle creates a fresh look of the pair PERIOD

The nature and cityscapes of the Pacific Northwest are emphasized by the shady depths of his photos PERIOD Many of the pieces in this series are taken with the use of a drone which gives you the birds eye view of the lush forest that many Oregonians only dream of seeing for themselves PERIOD Each photo shows Rukundos eye for the overlooked parts of landscapes and cityscapes PERIOD

SOLITUDE is the new and intriguing photo exhibit at the Adell McMillan Gallery in the Erb Memorial Union featuring a diverse collection of landscapes cityscapes monuments roads and forests PERIOD

Travelling Rukundo notes has been one of the main contributing factors in creating their unique style of photography and visual art PERIOD Over the years they have been to Redwoods California Brookings Oregon Istanbul Sweden Mozambique Togo Kenya Austin Texas and many other places that made a profound impact on the way they see the world PERIOD Solitude is a new exhibition currently being featured in the Adell McMillan Gallery in the EMU PERIOD The Artist Ugandan photographer Desire Rukundo composes digital images of nature people and cities with a particular focus on movement inspired by solitude. pERIOD Sam Henry  The Daily Emerald

After moving to Salem Oregon from Kampala Uganda six years ago Rukundo went into a Walmart and purchased some sketchbooks PERIOD After many sketches featuring his love for weird shapes like one line drawings of faces he wished for something new PERIOD

I have to find a hobby that kind of speaks to me that I would want to do every single day and meet people make connections and whatnot Rukundo said PERIOD With a summer job he slowly saved up for a new interest  photography PERIOD After another Walmart run he returned with a Canon Rebel T6 his first camera PERIOD

His first endeavors with his camera consisted of many photoshoots with friends and people who hired him PERIOD For the first four and a half years with his first camera he grew his skills and experience PERIOD

Ive done weddings with it PERIOD Ive done shoots with Wrangler jeans with it Ive traveled with it I take it everywhere like the beach everywhere PERIOD Literally every time I go to work I have my little backpack Rukundo said PERIOD Building a network with people and brands has helped to grow Rukundos strengths in photography PERIOD

Since starting on Instagram he has grown his following to over  PERIOD Even with that many people following his work he still enjoys seeing peoples reactions PERIOD When his mother or a friend takes him somewhere even in Salem where he has taken many photos he still finds new perspectives on familiar places PERIOD

People live in an area but they just dont appreciate how beautiful it is until you get to photograph it Rukundo said PERIOD Helping people see something new with different angels and times of day helps draw in more people to Rukundos images PERIOD

His style is more muted PERIOD And although he might have darker tones or more calm essences to his pictures I think they bring so much power Kundai Kapurura the gallery assistant who helped organize the event said PERIOD

Kapurura wanted to allow Rukundo to share his work on campus and with the greater community PERIOD The shadowy images reveal a beautiful moment in time in Oregon that Oregonians and people from outofstate can both appreciate PERIOD

The exhibit will be on display through Dec PERIOD  for students faculty and visitors to enjoy the nine magnificent prints between classes or while studying in the gallery PERIOD A closing reception for the gallery will happen on Dec PERIOD  at  p.m PERIOD within the exhibit PERIOD

AC Reporter





The Daily Emerald is the news division of Emerald Media Group University of Oregons independent student media organization PERIOD
